modules.addWordsToStartLearning: Add some words to your learning list to get started

errors.networkError: Network error, please check your connection

help.title: Help Center
help.description: Find answers to common questions about using the TOEIC Learning app

gettingStarted.title: Getting Started
gettingStarted.createAccountContent: Tap the Register button on the login screen and fill in your details to create a new account.
gettingStarted.navigationContent: Use the drawer menu by tapping the menu icon in the top-left corner to access different sections of the app.
gettingStarted.trackProgressContent: Go to the Progress section in the drawer menu to view your learning statistics and achievements.

studyFeatures.title: Study Features
studyFeatures.vocabularyContent: Browse through word lists, learn definitions, and practice with interactive exercises in the Vocabulary section.
studyFeatures.listeningContent: Access audio recordings and listening exercises designed to improve your comprehension skills.
studyFeatures.grammarContent: Learn and practice TOEIC grammar rules with examples and exercises in the Grammar section.

testPreparation.title: Test Preparation
testPreparation.practiceContent: Take timed practice tests that simulate the real TOEIC exam experience.
testPreparation.strategiesContent: Learn effective strategies for each section of the TOEIC test.
testPreparation.scoringContent: Understand how your practice test scores correlate with actual TOEIC test scores.

accountSettings.title: Account Settings
accountSettings.changePasswordContent: Go to Settings in the drawer menu and select the option to update your password.
accountSettings.updateProfileContent: Access your profile settings to update personal information and preferences.
accountSettings.notificationsContent: Customize your notification preferences in the Settings section.

troubleshooting.title: Troubleshooting
troubleshooting.loginIssuesContent: If you can't login, try resetting your password or contacting support at support@toeiclearning.com
troubleshooting.contentLoadingContent: Check your internet connection and try restarting the app if content isn't loading properly.
troubleshooting.appPerformanceContent: If the app is running slowly, try clearing the cache in your device's application settings.

help.contactSupportContent: Need more help? Contact our support team at support@toeiclearning.com

practice.takeTheTest: Would you like to take the test?

tips.writeClearly: Write clearly and organize your thoughts

tips.useVariedVocabulary: Use varied vocabulary and sentence structures

speaking.title: Speaking Practice
speaking.tapMicrophoneToStart: Tap the microphone to start speaking
speaking.welcomeMessage: Hello! Welcome to your TOEIC speaking practice session. I'm here to help you improve your English speaking skills. Let's start with a simple question: How are you feeling today?
speaking.loginRequired: Please log in to start a speaking session
speaking.mockSpeechFeedback: I understand you're saying: '{text}'. That's a great response!
speaking.speechRecognitionPermissionRequired: Speech recognition permission is required for this feature
speaking.audioRecordingPermissionRequired: Audio recording permission is required for this feature. Please enable microphone access in settings.
speaking.noSpeechDetectedCanStillPractice: No speech detected. Recording saved but speech-to-text failed. You can still practice!
speaking.userMadeRecordingButSpeechNotRecognized: User made an audio recording but speech was not recognized.

toeicPractice.title: TOEIC Practice
toeicPractice.permissionDenied: Microphone or speech recognition permission denied
toeicPractice.part1Instruction: Now, let's start with Part 1. I will show you a picture. Please describe this picture to me.
toeicPractice.part2Instruction: Great. Let's move to Part 2. I will ask you a question. My question is: 'How do you usually go to work in the morning?'
toeicPractice.part5Instruction: Excellent. Now it's Part 5. I will give you an incomplete sentence and four choices. You must choose the word or phrase that best completes the sentence. Here's the sentence: 'The new manager is responsible for ------- the entire team.' Your choices are: (A) supervise, (B) supervising, (C) supervision, (D) supervised. Please choose the correct answer and explain why.
toeicPractice.part5Question:
The new manager is responsible for ------- the entire team.

(A) supervise
(B) supervising
(C) supervision
(D) supervised

part1.describeDetail: Describe what you see in this image in detail.
part1.describePeople: Tell me about the people and activities in this picture.
part1.describeScene: What is happening in this image? Describe the scene.
part1.describeSetting: Describe the setting and atmosphere of this picture.
part1.identifyObjects: What objects or elements can you identify in this image?

part2.lastWeekend: What did you do last weekend?
part2.favoriteHobby: What is your favorite hobby and why?
part2.futurePlans: What are your plans for the future?
part2.memorableExperience: Describe a memorable experience you had recently.
part2.favoriteMusic: What type of music do you enjoy and why?
part2.favoriteRestaurant: Tell me about your favorite restaurant.
part2.freeTime: What do you like to do in your free time?

meetingPostponed.question: The meeting _____ postponed until next week due to technical issues.
meetingPostponed.options: A) was B) were C) is D) are
meetingPostponed.explanation: Use "was" because "meeting" is singular and the sentence is in past tense.

workingYears.question: She has been working here _____ five years.
workingYears.options: A) since B) for C) during D) from
workingYears.explanation: Use "for" with a period of time (five years).

reportCompleted.question: The report must be _____ by Friday.
reportCompleted.options: A) complete B) completed C) completing D) completion
reportCompleted.explanation: Use past participle "completed" in passive voice construction.

achieveTargets.question: We need to _____ our sales targets this quarter.
achieveTargets.options: A) achieve B) achievement C) achieving D) achieved

weatherImproves.question: _____ the weather improves, we will cancel the outdoor event.
weatherImproves.options: A) If B) Unless C) When D) Because
weatherImproves.explanation: Use "Unless" meaning "if not" - if the weather does not improve.

defaultEvaluation.feedback: Good effort! Your response shows understanding of the task. Continue practicing to improve fluency and accuracy.
defaultEvaluation.strengths: You attempted to answer the question and showed effort in your response.
defaultEvaluation.improvements: Focus on expanding your vocabulary, improving grammar accuracy, and practicing speaking more fluently.

defaultStudyPlan.levelAssessment: Based on available data, you show intermediate-level English speaking skills.
defaultStudyPlan.timeline: 2-3 months of consistent practice for noticeable improvement

prompts.followUpFallback: Can you tell me more about that?
prompts.part1Evaluation:
You are an expert TOEIC speaking examiner using advanced AI evaluation criteria. Evaluate this Part 1 response (image description) comprehensively.

Context: TOEIC Speaking Test Part 1 - Describe a Picture
Question: {question}
Student's Response: "{userResponse}"

Provide a detailed evaluation in JSON format with score, feedback, pronunciation_score, fluency_score, grammar_score, vocabulary_score, content_relevance_score, strengths, improvements, grammar_errors, vocabulary_suggestions, speaking_tips, estimated_toeic_level, and confidence_level.

Evaluation Criteria (TOEIC Official Rubric):
- Content Relevance & Accuracy (20%): How well does the response describe the image?
- Grammar & Sentence Structure (25%): Proper use of tenses, articles, etc.
- Vocabulary Usage & Range (20%): Appropriate and varied word choice
- Fluency & Coherence (20%): Natural flow and logical organization
- Pronunciation & Clarity (15%): Clear articulation and stress patterns

Be encouraging yet constructive. Provide specific examples from their response.
prompts.part2Evaluation:
You are an expert TOEIC speaking examiner with advanced AI capabilities. Evaluate this Part 2 response (Question & Answer) using official TOEIC criteria.

Context: TOEIC Speaking Test Part 2 - Question & Response
Question: {question}
Student's Response: "{userResponse}"

Provide comprehensive evaluation in JSON format with score, feedback, relevance_score, grammar_score, vocabulary_score, fluency_score, completeness_score, strengths, improvements, grammar_errors, vocabulary_suggestions, conversation_tips, cultural_appropriateness, estimated_toeic_level, follow_up_suggestions, and confidence_level.

TOEIC Official Criteria:
- Relevance to Question (25%): Direct response to what was asked
- Grammar & Language Use (25%): Correct structures and forms
- Vocabulary Range & Accuracy (20%): Appropriate and varied expressions
- Fluency & Coherence (15%): Natural rhythm and logical flow
- Completeness of Response (15%): Adequate development of ideas

Provide encouraging feedback while maintaining accuracy standards.
prompts.part5Evaluation:
You are an expert TOEIC grammar examiner with advanced linguistic analysis capabilities. Evaluate this Part 5 response (grammar question explanation) using comprehensive criteria.

Context: TOEIC Speaking Test Part 5 - Grammar & Explanation
Grammar Question: {question}
Answer Options: {options}
Correct Answer: {correct}
Official Explanation: {explanation}
Student's Response: "{userResponse}"

Provide detailed evaluation in JSON format with score, feedback, answer_accuracy, explanation_quality, language_use, grammar_understanding, communication_clarity, strengths, improvements, correct_answer_given, explanation_accuracy, alternative_explanations, related_grammar_points, study_recommendations, metalinguistic_awareness, estimated_toeic_level, and confidence_level.

Evaluation Criteria:
- Correct Answer Selection (30%): Did they choose the right answer?
- Quality of Explanation (35%): How well did they explain the grammar rule?
- Language Accuracy & Clarity (20%): Grammar and vocabulary in their explanation
- Metalinguistic Understanding (15%): Depth of grammar rule comprehension

Focus on both accuracy and pedagogical understanding. Encourage learning mindset.
prompts.followUpGeneration:
You are an adaptive TOEIC speaking examiner with advanced conversational AI. Generate an intelligent, personalized follow-up question based on the student's response.

Context:
- TOEIC Part: {partType}
- Original Question: {originalQuestion}
- Student's Response: "{userResponse}"

Instructions:
1. Analyze the student's language level and response quality
2. Create a follow-up that builds on their answer naturally
3. Adjust difficulty appropriately (slightly challenging but achievable)
4. Make it conversational and engaging
5. Focus on areas that need improvement while being encouraging

Generate a follow-up question that:
- Relates directly to their specific response content
- Encourages elaboration or clarification
- Helps assess their speaking ability further
- Maintains appropriate TOEIC difficulty level
- Feels natural in conversation flow

Return only the follow-up question, nothing else.

Examples of good follow-ups:
- "That's interesting! Can you tell me more about [specific detail they mentioned]?"
- "You mentioned [X]. How does that compare to [related topic]?"
- "What do you think would happen if [scenario based on their response]?"
- "Can you give me a specific example of what you just described?"
prompts.adaptiveQuestionGeneration:
You are an expert TOEIC test creator with access to advanced AI capabilities. Generate a personalized TOEIC {partType} question with appropriate difficulty.

Parameters:
- Part Type: {partType}
- Difficulty Level: {difficultyLevel}
- Previous Performance: {previousPerformance}

For Part 1 (Image Description):
Return a detailed, engaging prompt for describing an image that tests:
- Vocabulary range and accuracy
- Grammar structures appropriate to level
- Descriptive language skills

For Part 2 (Question & Response):
Create a conversational question that:
- Relates to common TOEIC themes (work, travel, education, etc.)
- Matches the specified difficulty level
- Encourages natural, extended responses

For Part 5 (Grammar):
Generate a grammar question with:
- Realistic business/academic context
- Clear distractors that test specific grammar points
- Proper difficulty level progression

Return JSON format with question, options (Part 5 only), correct (Part 5 only), explanation (Part 5 only), topic, difficulty_indicators, and learning_objectives.
